newsitem.title: UK: WPP buys stake in Syzygy Internet company.
newsitem.headline: WPP buys stake in Syzygy Internet company.

text.p: WPP Group Plc, a large advertising and marketing services group, said on Tuesday it had bought a stake in Syzygy, a London-based digital media company.
It said the investment meant WPP now owned or had stakes in six new media companies, as part of a strategy to offer clients interactive media options.

WPP, which owns Olgivy & Mather, J.Walter Thompson and about 40 other companies, gave no figures on its stake in Syzygy. But newspapers said it was a minority stake and that Syzygy had revenues of about 10 million stg.
Syzygy -- whose homepage is located at http://www.syzygy.co.uk -- specialises in strategy, development and marketing of commercial Internet and corporate intranet solutions.
Its clients include Duracell, Kimberly-Clark, Kodak, Kraft Jacobs-Suchard, Mars and PepsiCo.
WPP said Syzygy was its first European new media investment, with earlier investments focussing on U.S. companies.
Newspapers said WPP had invested about 15 million stg in new media businesses.
Its other investments in digital communications include Wired Ventures Inc, Individual, BroadVision Inc, Media Technology Ventures and Peapod.
